text:
If my web application's web.xml file contains this:

    <filter-mapping>
      <filter-name>Test Filter</filter-name>
      <url-pattern>/*.jsp</url-pattern>
    </filter-mapping>

then the filter doesn't run when I invoke a JSP in the application's top-level directory.

If I change the url-pattern to this:

      <url-pattern>*.jsp</url-pattern>

then the filter does run.

I'll upload a .war file and some instructions to demonstrate the problem shortly.
creator: rnewman@thecia.net
rnewman@thecia.net
text:
Created attachment 7460
this is a WAR file that you can install in the webapps directory of Tomcat to demonstrate the problem.

Install the WAR file as webapps/filter-test.war .

In your browser, go to http://localhost:8080/filter-test/test.jsp

You'll see "TestFilterRan=null".  If the filter had run, you would instead have seen 
"TestFilterRan=true".

Edit web.xml as suggested in my bug report, and reload the application, and you'll see that the 
filter does run.
creator: rnewman@thecia.net

text:
According to section 11.2 of the servlet spec, the mapping /*.jsp matches only 
a file with the literal name '*.jsp' sitting at the context root.
creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
